mtc:Taxon.name: Source.MassFlowRate.Gas

mtc:Parameter.name: MassFlowRate
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Mass of a substance passing through a specific cross-sectional area

mtc:Parameter.name: Temperature
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Temperature of the gas used during the measurement

mtc:Parameter.name: Pressure
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Pressure of the gas used during the measurement

mtc:Parameter.name: RelativeHumidity
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Relative humidity (water content) of the gas used during measurement, mostly applicable to ambient air as the medium

mtc:Parameter.name: Compressibility
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Relative volume change as a result of a pressure change of the gas used

mtc:Parameter.name: ReferenceTemperature
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Reference temperature condition to or from which to correct the flow rate

mtc:Parameter.name: ReferencePressure
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Reference pressure condition to or from which to correct the flow rate

mtc:Parameter.name: ReferenceRelativeHumidity
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Reference Relative Humidity: condition to or from which to correct the flow rate

mtc:Parameter.name: ReferenceCompressibility
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Relative volume change as a result of a pressure change for the reference gas

mtc:Parameter.name: ReynoldsNumber
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Dimensionless quantity that characterizes the degree of laminar versus turbulent flow

mtc:Parameter.name: GasVelocity
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: speed of the gas through the measurement area

mtc:Parameter.name: Diameter
mtc:Parameter.mtc:Definition: Diameter of the pipe used in the measurement

mtc:Taxon.mtc:Definition: This process sources a reference mass flow rate of gas for calibrating gas-flow meters. The instantaneous mass flow rate q_m equals dm/dt, sometimes estimated as ∆m/∆t using the total mass ∆m flowing through a defined surface in time ∆t.
